resources.string: An error occurred while synchronizing with RoboZZle.com. Try again later manually
Can\'t submit telemetry due to a network error.
Can\'t submit telemetry due to an unknown error.
Already synchronizing. This could take a while.
Sync is started. This could take a while. You can solve new puzzles as soon as they appear.
No puzzles found. Use Menu -> Download puzzles to download them from the Internet.
The robot left colored cells. You lost. Try again.
The stack overflowed. You lost. Try again.
No more instructions to execute. You lost. Try again.
Step limit reached. You lost. Try again.
Can\'t modify the program while running
No solution to this puzzle stored locally
Limited memory mode is enabled for thumbnails. See settings for options.
Not enough memory. Check thumbnail settings.
Controls how puzzle thumbnails use memory
Submit every single step towards puzzle solution to help our AI research
Login failed: can not parse server response.
Login failed: your device is not compatible.
Login failed: your device does not support hash algorithm.
Login failed: incorrect user name or password.
To synchronize solutions, set your credentials to RoboZZle.com in settings, then start sync again.
History loading failed. Be careful, history may work incorrectly.
Can\'t load the puzzle. The incident will be reported.

The game field is a 16x12 cells rectangle. Each cell may be colored with one of three colors: red, green, or blue. Each cell may contain an item. Your goal is to collect all the items with a robot. Beware of non-colored cells.

A robot is placed somewhere on the field. It is initially directed either up, right, down or left. You can control the robot with a program. A program consists of up to 5 functions depending on the puzzle. Functions are called F1, F2, F3, F4 and F5. Each function consists of up to 10 instructions for the robot. The instructions are right and left turns, step forward, cell painting (changes the color of the cell which the robot is currently located in), and function call. There are unconditional instructions which are executed always, and conditional ones which are executed only if robot is located in a cell with the same color. Function calls are recursive. After a function is completed, control is switched back to the next instruction of the caller. Your program does not need to end. To solve a puzzle it is enough to collect all the items.

Tap an instruction to change or clear it. Start and control your program execution with play, pause, step and rewind buttons. Hold a finger on the game field to speed up running. Your current solution progress is automatically saved.
There are some tricks that can be done with recursion. It is up to you now to figure them out.
The robot program is empty. Add commands by clicking numbered cells.
donate from 1$ to 256$ and remove ads
Run away before even starting to try solving
Beat all puzzles you were afraid of
Drive the robot across popular spirals
Solve all puzzles made by the inventor of RoboZZle
Solve cloning puzzles (Reflection, Replication Engine, and 960 on blue)
Beat all popular puzzles with difficulty 75+
Solve at least half of popular puzzles
The answer to Life, Universe, and Everything
Solve all popular puzzles with difficulty 42

RoboZZle Droid is a port of Igor Ostrovsky game. 


This is an Open Source project. See GitHub 


Achievement icons are modified icons, made by Freepik, Dave Gandy, SimpleIcon, Plainicon from www.flaticon.com; is licensed by CC BY 3.0

Share the steps you take to solve RoboZZles with an AI research project. The goal is to build a fully automated solver for RoboZZles. We will analyze what does it take for you to solve puzzles, and improve our algorithm accordingly.

1. You allow submission of puzzle solution telemetry to Lost Tech LLC. 
Submitted telemetry can include: 
- opening puzzle 
- program editing steps (editing commands, undo, redo, etc.) 
- running, stopping, pausing, and stepping with a robot 
- timestamps for all actions above 
- your login and hashed password for RoboZZle.com 
 
2. You allow Lost Tech LLC to use your login and hashed password for RoboZZle.com to verify that you have a valid account on RoboZZle.com. Lost Tech LLC will not store this data or share it with 3rd parties. 
 
3. You allow all other telemetry listed in 1. to be used for the purpose of research in artificial intelligence. 
 
4. You allow Lost Tech LLC royalty-free use of this data, and any derived products of the research for any commercial purpose, including sharing with 3rd parties.
You must sign in to submit telemetry
